name: Captain Ahab
description:
'''Captain Ahab''' was an American [[electronic music]] duo based in Los Angeles, California. They referred to their DIY take on [[jumpstyle]] and [[electropop]] music as "ravesploitation". The band was made up of producer/vocalist Jonathan Snipes and [[hype man]] Jim Merson.

They were known for their provocative lyrics and high-energy shows where a sweaty, [[Nudity in live performance|half-dressed]] Merson would descend into the crowd to dance and [[Grinding (dance)|grind]] on audience members.

In June 2006, Captain Ahab won a contest to have their song "Snakes on the Brain" included on the [[enhanced CD]] portion of the soundtrack to the film ''[[Snakes on a Plane]]''.
 
On September 28, 2006, their song "Girls Gone Wild" was played briefly in "[[The Convention (The Office episode)|The Convention]]", the second episode of the third season of ''[[The Office (U.S. TV series)|The Office]]''.

Their single "Was Love" was written for and played in the first-season episode "Gravedancing" on the [[Syfy]] series ''[[Caprica]]'', as well as the remix of Maxfemm's "Weak Condition"

They played their final show at [[The Smell]], in Los Angeles, California on Friday, November 2, 2012, to a sold-out crowd. Also performing that evening were Toxic Lipstick, [[Foot Village]], and [[Books on Tape (artist)|Books on Tape]]. The final show was announced via a music video on [[Vimeo]] on September 16, 2012.

Snipes is now a member of the [[experimental music|experimental]] and [[industrial hip hop]] trio [[Clipping (band)|clipping.]], alongside fellow producer William Hutson and rapper [[Daveed Diggs]].
